resources.string: Improvider will help you to make your own musical improvisation!
How is that possible? I am not a musician!

You have surely seen some musicians improvise their solo completely? Divine inspiration? Years of work? Knowledge of thousands of music phrases? Maybe, but not only. Actually, the main tool to improvise solos are the scales. For a musicien, the idea is to search a scale adapted to the backing according to the chords played by his fellow musicians. Then, many musicians "print" visually that scale on their instrument. After that, they know they can play only on the keys/cases/buttons... they previously "printed". Improvider simply suggests you to launch a playback already contained within the app, and choose for you a classic scale for improvising on that track, and print it on the tactile keyboard by coloring the keys you should play with green. Now, up to you to experiment, let you feelings express themselves, and by the way, enjoy!
Within the backing tab, you will find the controls and settings concerning the backing.
Within the Piano tab, you will find the keyboard which some keys have been colored. It is an adapted scale for the backing.
The idea is: you should only play on the colored keys, it will sound alright! To convince yourself, just experiment and try other keys.
Within the settings tab, it is possible to set some parameters of the keyboard.
Back to the backing choice page
Piano scale: number of white keys
